„Äê

#‚Äã704 ‚Äî September 12, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The State of ES5 on the Web ‚Äî Some of the earlier JavaScript build tools focused on allowing developers to write modern JavaScript code that could still run on the browsers of the time by compiling code down to ES5. Time has moved on, but have the tools or popular libraries? Philip investigates, and shares some¬†recommendations.

Philip Walton

üìä ¬†The Top 5000 npm Packages by Size, Downloads, and Traffic ‚Äî An interesting Google Sheets spreadsheet listing the top 5000 npm packages by package size, weekly downloads, and weekly traffic. One package is responsible for 278 terabytes of traffic per week, but the top 5000 add up to several petabytes.

Google Sheets / danhorus

Run GitHub Actions Up to 2x Faster at Half the Cost ‚Äî Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code¬†faster.

Blacksmith sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.6 ‚Äî The latest TypeScript has landed with full support for iterator helpers, support for arbitrary module identifiers, --noUncheckedSideEffectImports to import modules without importing any values, and more ‚Äî all covered in the always thorough release¬†post.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Is PHP the New JavaScript? ‚Äî I‚Äôm no real fan of PHP, but there‚Äôs been a lot of discussion on social media around increased interest in PHP by developers who‚Äôd usually steer clear of it, largely thanks to Laravel. This post tells the basic story and explains what Laravel brings to the¬†table.

Dave Kiss (Mux)

IN BRIEF:

  • Cloudflare Workers has greatly improved its npm package support. The popular serverless platform now supports a lot more Node.js APIs.

  • üéâ They don't happen often, but Frontend Masters is currently running a sale on its courses, which now includes a JS performance learning¬†path.

  • The ESLint project has announced its latest version support policy with ESLint v8.x going into end of life next month.

  • üìÖ Vercel's Next.js Conf 2024 is taking place this October 24, both in person in San Francisco, as well as¬†online.

RELEASES:

  • Storybook 8.3 ‚Äì Frontend component and UI¬†workshop. Now with first class Vitest¬†support.

  • ESLint 9.10 ‚Äì Now with types included.

  • pnpm 9.10, Jasmine 5.3, Relay 18.0

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

The Web's Clipboard, and How It Stores Data of Different Types ‚Äî An interesting exploration of how things currently work with copy and pasting on the web, how different data types are treated, and what the Web Custom Formats proposal is putting¬†forward.

Alex Harri J√≥nsson

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future ‚Äî 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, and more. Just added support for Node.js built-in node:test¬†framework!

Wallaby Team sponsor

Building the Same App Using Various Web Frameworks ‚Äî A scientist at Amazon who usually works in Python with a minimum of JavaScript on the frontend wondered if a more modern web framework would suit him better in 2024. To try this out, he tried Next.js, SvelteKit, and the Python-flavored FastHTML.

Eugene Yan

Brand New Performance Features in Chrome DevTools ‚Äî A helpful look into Chrome‚Äôs updated Performance Panel and all the different metrics it shows off to help you improve the performance of your¬†site.

Umar Hansa (DebugBear)

React and FormData ‚Äî FormData is ironically both the ‚Äònewest and yet oldest‚Äô standard for accessing form data. Here are some practical ways for using it with¬†TypeScript.

Brad Westfall

Automate Neon Schema Changes with Drizzle and GitHub Actions ‚Äî Learn about schema migrations and how they can be applied to a Neon database with Drizzle and GitHub¬†Actions.

Clerk sponsor

üìÑ The Secrets of JavaScript's delete Operator Zachary Lee

üìÑ Deploying a Next.js App to Production on Any Server Kurta Payjama

üìÑ How to Create a Weekly Google Analytics Report That Posts to Slack Paul Scanlon

üìÑ Top 10 Angular Architecture Mistakes You Really Want To Avoid Tomas Trajan

üìÑ How to Fix ESLint Violations with AI Assistance Docker Labs

üì∫ Why You Should Use Redux in 2024 Mark Erikson

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Biome v1.9 Released; Turns One Year Old ‚Äî Biome started life as a fork of Rome, a bold attempt to create an all-in-one ‚Äòfrontend toolchain‚Äô. As of v1.9, Biome can format and lint CSS, GraphQL, and JavaScript, does it very quickly, yet has 97% compatibility with¬†Prettier.

Victorien Elvinger & Biome Core Team

Express.js 5.0 Released ‚Äî The seminal Node.js webapp library seemed to take a nap for a few years, but development was reinvigorated earlier this year. v5.0 brings a variety of modern tweaks and dependency updates, though it's still tagged next at the npm registry. (Official homepage and v5.x API¬†docs.)

Wesley Todd

‚úÇÔ∏è Cut Your QA Cycles Down from Hours to Minutes ‚Äî QA Wolf's AI-native approach gets engineering teams to 80% automated end-to-end test coverage and helps them ship 2x faster by reducing QA cycles from hours to¬†minutes.

QA Wolf sponsor

Jimp 1.6: Manipulate Images without Native Dependencies ‚Äî Most image libraries, such as Sharp, use native dependencies to do the heavy lifting, but Jimp can handle numerous formats directly for blurring, color tweaks, resizing, rotation, etc. Originally for Node, Jimp now works in the browser too ‚Äì GitHub¬†repo.

jimp Contributors

Valtio 2.0: Proxy State Made Simple ‚Äî Turns objects into self-aware proxies so you can access state and subscribe to changes outside of components, add computed properties and more. Designed for React and compatible with Suspense, but can also be used with vanilla JS. ‚Äì GitHub¬†repo.

Daishi Kato

Violentmonkey: A Way to Run Userscripts in the Browser ‚Äî There have been many extensions to run your own custom JavaScript automatically on certain Web pages over the years, but Violentmonkey seems to currently be one of the better and well maintained open source ones. GitHub¬†repo.

Violentmonkey Team

  • üîé Orama 2.1 ‚Äì Dependency-free, full-text and vector search engine for all JS¬†runtimes, with typo tolerance, filters, facets, stemming, and¬†more.

  • create-fastify 5.0 ‚Äì Rapidly generate a Fastify project. It just takes npm¬†init¬†fastify¬†app_name to get¬†started.

  • file-type 19.5 ‚Äì Detect the file type of a file, stream, or¬†data. Now with WebVTT¬†support.

  • TWGL.js 6.1 ‚Äì Helpers for working with low-level WebGL from¬†JS.

  • üé® Chroma.js 3.1 ‚Äì JavaScript color manipulation¬†library.

  • Pixi.js 8.4 ‚Äì Fast, flexible 2D WebGL renderer.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã706 ‚Äî September 26, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Deno 2.0 Release Candidate ‚Äî Deno started life as a manifestation of ideas that Node‚Äôs original creator, Ryan Dahl, had after his experiences with Node. Deno 2 is the next step: how the Deno team thinks Deno should ultimately be. Many changes await: window is gone and Node‚Äôs process appears, dependency management has been improved, numerous APIs have gone stable (e.g. WebGPU), and both Node.js API and CommonJS support have continued to¬†improve.

Bartek Iwa≈Ñczuk and Andy Jiang

Don't Sleep on AbortController ‚Äî AbortController is a broadly available mechanism for, originally, aborting Web requests on demand, but you can use it for a lot more than that (or ‚Äòanything!‚Äô, as Artem¬†explains).

Artem Zakharchenko

Learn to Build Feature-Rich, Native Mobile Apps Using React Native and Expo ‚Äî Join Kadi Kraman for a video course designed to hone your React skills. Whether a beginner, or looking to further refine your skill set, you'll learn to create practical iOS and Android apps, covering components, styling, UX, linting, async storage, animation, and much¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

How Josh W. Comeau Rebuilt His Blog, App Router Style ‚Äî We‚Äôre huge fans of Josh‚Äôs blog and he‚Äôs just rebuilt it entirely using Next.js, MDX, Sandpack, and an array of other technologies. Here, he goes into great depth about what's involved. A good look behind the scenes of a modern React-driven¬†project.

Josh W Comeau

IN BRIEF:

  • üá™üá∫ NodeConf EU is back. It takes place in Ireland this November 3-6.

  • üü® It also appears JSConf is coming back under the care of the OpenJS¬†Foundation.

  • üìä Minification Benchmarks is a frequently updated set of benchmarks for a suite of popular JavaScript¬†minifiers.

  • üïπÔ∏è The most recent JS13kGames gamedev contest just ended. If you want to play the entries (or do some judging yourself) they're all here. I particularly liked The Way of the Dodo and¬†Deep13.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.1.29 ‚Äì Its C compilation feature gets N-API support, but is otherwise largely a bugfix¬†release.

  • Storybook 8.3 ‚Äì A popular frontend component workshop is now using Vitest to rapidly speed up its component testing¬†features.

  • Strapi 5 ‚Äì Popular open source headless¬†CMS.

  • Solid 1.9 ‚Äì Declarative and performant reactivity for building¬†UIs.

  • PostgreSQL 17 ‚Äì The popular database isn't a JavaScript project, but a lot of you will be using¬†it. Psst! We have a Postgres newsletter¬†too!

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

A Guide to Destructuring in JavaScript ‚Äî The destructuring assignment syntax appeared in ES6 almost ten years ago and has become a central part of modern JavaScript development. This is a good primer/reminder of the¬†potential.

Mat Marquis

The Nine Node Pillars: Principles for Doing Node Right ‚Äî A group of prolific and productive Node.js contributors have put together a checklist to identify gaps in your current Node development practices, particularly when building large-scale¬†apps.

Snell, Venditto, Dawson, Collina, et al.

A Complete Guide to Session Management in Next.js ‚Äî Learn how integrating session management into your app provides robust security and enhances user¬†experience.

Clerk sponsor

What Are Durable Functions? A Visual JavaScript Primer ‚Äî This is rather dependent on what Inngest, a durable function service, offers, but is a good primer to the general idea which may well suit your use¬†cases.

Lydia Hallie (Inngest)

What's New in Express.js 5.0 ‚Äî Express.js 5.0 landed recently with rather brief release notes, so here's a deeper look at what it has to offer. The updates are largely incremental, but set the stage for Express‚Äôs¬†future.

Trevor I. Lasn

Angular Routing Essentials: Everything in One Post ‚Äî A bold claim, but it does a pretty good¬†job.

Oleksandr Kocherhin

Using Reddit's JSON API from a JavaScript App ‚Äî How to pull data from Reddit‚Äôs API and display it in a simple web application built with¬†Parcel.

Muhammed Ali

üì∫ Create a Donkey Kong Country-ish Platformer in JS ‚Äì We don‚Äôt see the DKC resemblance, but it‚Äôs a solid 4 hour¬†screencast. Chris Courses

üìÑ Implementing a 'Like' Button without Authentication Abhishek Saha

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Schedule-X 2: A Modern Event Calendar Component ‚Äî Available in the form of React/Preact, Vue, Svelte, Angular, or plain JS components. Open source but with a premium version with extra features. GitHub¬†repo.

Tom √ñsterlund

üßπ¬†Vue Mess Detector: Code and Quality Analysis for Vue¬†Projects ‚Äî A static analysis tool that can catch various bugs and code quality issues in Vue-based projects, built atop rules from the Vue.js Style Guide and others. GitHub¬†repo.

Various Contributors

‚úÇÔ∏è Cut Your QA Cycles Down from Hours to Minutes ‚Äî QA Wolf's AI-native approach gets engineering teams to 80% automated end-to-end test coverage and helps them ship 2x faster by reducing QA cycles from hours to¬†minutes.

QA Wolf sponsor

Tesseract.js: Pure JS OCR for 100+ Languages ‚Äî A port of the C++-based Tesseract library commonly used for extract text from images. The homepage has a live demo where you can drop your own images. GitHub¬†repo.

Tesseract Team

HumanifyJS: Deobfuscate JavaScript Code using ChatGPT ‚Äî There‚Äôs an in-depth explainer here. The primary feature is its ability to reverse the loss of meaningful variable and function names based on the context of the¬†code.

Jesse Luoto

Tests Are Dead. Meticulous Is Here ‚Äî Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Backed by YC, CTO of GitHub, CPO of Adobe, CEO of¬†Vercel.

Meticulous sponsor

React Snap Carousel: DOM-First, Headless Carousel ‚Äî Uses native browser scrolling and CSS scroll snap points for performance. Try out some of its features in its Storybook. The latest version adds support for infinite¬†carousels.

Richard Scarrott

üí° For more React projects, check out our latest React newsletter.

  • Perspective 3.1 ‚Äì Streaming data viz and analytics component. The core is written in C++ and compiled to WebAssembly. The homepage shows it off¬†well.

  • NeutralinoJS 5.4 ‚Äì Lightweight cross-platform desktop app¬†framework.

  • websocket-as-promised 3.0 ‚Äì A Promise-based API for WebSockets.

  • Verdaccio 6.0 ‚Äì Lightweight local private npm¬†registry.

  • Rspack 1.0.7 ‚Äì Fast Rust-based web¬†bundler.

  • esbuild 0.24

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã705 ‚Äî September 19, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript‚Ñ¢? Weekly

'Oracle, It‚Äôs Time to Free JavaScript.' ‚Äî It‚Äôs long been a bone of contention that Oracle owns the trademark for ‚ÄòJavaScript‚Äô (we put out a call two years ago) but this marks the first serious effort to try and change that, including petitioning the USPTO, if necessary. You can support the effort by signing this open letter, joining a vast array of JavaScript¬†luminaries.

The JavaScript Community

Now You Can Compile and Run C in JavaScript ‚Äî Well, if you‚Äôre using Bun, at least. Bun v1.1.28 lands experimental support for compiling and native C code and then running its functions from¬†JavaScript. It's easier than it¬†sounds..

Jarred Sumner (Bun)

üòÖ Bun's creator said this is "an unplanned feature I worked on mostly a month ago on a Saturday for fun" ‚Äì that's our kinda¬†fun!

‚úÇÔ∏è Cut Your QA Cycles Down from Hours to Minutes with QA Wolf ‚Äî If slow QA processes bottleneck your software engineering team and you‚Äôre releasing slower because of it, you must check out QA Wolf. QA Wolf gets engineering teams to 80% automated end-to-end test coverage and helps them ship 2x faster by reducing QA cycles from hours to minutes. Learn¬†more.

QA Wolf sponsor

ts-blank-space: Fast Type-Stripping TypeScript to JS Compiler ‚Äî It‚Äôs job is simple: be the fastest TS to JS compiler written in JS (it‚Äôs 5.6x faster than tsc.) Types are simply replaced with whitespace preserving the coordinates of the JS code which eliminates the need for sourcemaps¬†entirely.

Ashley Claymore / Bloomberg

IN BRIEF:

  • üèÜ Developer analyst firm RedMonk has put out a Q3 2024 ranking of programming languages with JavaScript happily in first¬†place.

  • üì∫ Honeypot has released a nine minute documentary where Ryan Dahl (the original creator of Node.js) and Bert Belder ‚ñ∂Ô∏è tell the story of how Deno began.

  • Talking of Deno, Deno 2.0 is expected to be released tomorrow.

  • üß≠ Alongside new releases of macOS, iOS, and iPadOS, Safari 18 has been released. Alongside numerous Web API enhancements, its JS regex support has been enhanced when it comes to¬†Unicode.

  • üî• David Bushell tried JSR ‚Äì he didn't like it.

RELEASES:

  • Fastify v5 ‚Äì Fastify is a popular, perf-focused web framework for Node.js, inspired by Express (which recently reached v5.0 too!)

  • Astro 5 Beta ‚Äì Astro helps keep the run of v5.0 releases going..

  • Node.js v22.9 (Current) ‚Äì Adds a util.getCallSite function to obtain the stacktrace of the current execution. V8's Maglev JIT is also disabled for reliability reasons due to outstanding issues in¬†V8.

  • Hono 4.6 ‚Äì The nifty 'any runtime' webapp framework gains context storage¬†middleware.

ViteConf is October 3rd! ‚Äî StackBlitz is r(ai)sing the bar in the ViteConf '24 keynote. You won‚Äôt want to miss it¬†üëÄ.

StackBlitz sponsor

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Mathematical Symbols and JavaScript Equivalents ‚Äî We‚Äôre not just talking the obvious like + and - but things like ‚Åø‚àö, Œ£, Œ†, ‚àÉ, and set¬†notation.

Joshua Nussbaum

A React 19 Cheat Sheet ‚Äî From Kent C Dodds, of Epic React fame, comes this part cheat sheet, part succinct reminder of some of the new things you can do in React¬†19, along with (very) brief code¬†examples.

Kent C. Dodds

[Workshop] Fix Your Front-End 101: JavaScript Edition ‚Äî Learn practical tips to debug JavaScript end to end. Join our JavaScript team live on Sept¬†24.

Sentry sponsor

From Parcel to Vite: A Short Story of a 100K LOC Migration ‚Äî ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve migrated our frontend projects from Parcel to Vite, and the process was‚Ä¶ smooth.‚Äù

Gao / Logto

How to Create a Chrome Extension with React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS and Vite ‚Äî Covers everything you need to know right through to publishing in the Chrome Web¬†Store.

Lokman Musliu

üì∫ Building a React-Powered TODO App in 9 Steps ‚Äì A 54 second video showing off the key stages, all without any libraries except¬†React. Danny Thompson

üìÑ 12 Ways to Better Vue Components with TypeScript Fotis Adamakis

üìÑ Why We Switched from Cypress to Playwright S Varun (BigBinary)

üìÑ Bitwise Operators in JavaScript and When to Use Them 8 Hobbies

üìÑ An Introduction to TanStack Router Adam Rackis

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

date-fns v4.0 Released with First-Class Time Zones Support ‚Äî date-fns is a hugely popular and comprehensive suite of 200+ functions for working with dates in JavaScript, and now there‚Äôs first-class time zone support¬†too.

Sasha Koss

ts-remove-unused: Remove Unused Code from TypeScript Projects ‚Äî A tool that can auto-fix unused exports (removing export from the declaration or the whole declaration based on its usage) and delete modules that have no referenced exports. Knip is another mature tool in this space, though focused more on detecting the things you can¬†remove.

LINE

Amplify the Benefits of JWTs and Session Tokens ‚Äî Learn how leveraging the benefits of both session token authentication and JWTs results in the best of both¬†approaches.

Clerk sponsor

Next.js SaaS Starter: A Next.js Template for SaaS Webapps ‚Äî A starter template for building a SaaS-style webapp using Next.js with authentication, Stripe integration, and a dashboard for users. It uses Postgres and Drizzle for the database and UI elements based on shadcn/ui and¬†Tailwind.

Lee Robinson (Vercel)

nano-spawn: Tiny Execa-Inspired Process Execution for Node.js ‚Äî If you‚Äôre familiar with Sindre‚Äôs Execa for running commands from a Node app in a reliable manner, nano-spawn offers its core functionality in a smaller package.

Sindre Sorhus and ehmicky

DECK.GL: GPU-Powered Large-Scale Data Visualization Framework ‚Äî Well suited to geospatial data visualization use cases that go beyond typical 2D views. There are plenty of examples to show it off. Can be used through both vanilla JS and React¬†interfaces.

OpenJS Foundation

Vue-Multiselect 3.1: A Complete 'Selecting Solution' for Vue.js ‚Äî There‚Äôs a lot on offer here, complete with SSR support, Vuex support, strong test coverage, and with no¬†dependencies.

Damian Dulisz et al.

Chokidar 4.0: Efficient Cross-Platform File Watching Node.js Library ‚Äî Wraps around fs.watch / fs.watchFile and normalizes the events received, applies best practices, and presents an API that works the same across¬†platforms.

Paul Miller

  • Express.js 4.21 ‚Äì We featured Express.js 5.0 last week, but the widely deployed 4.x branch continues to get¬†updates.

  • ‚≠ê Starlight 0.28 ‚Äì Astro‚Äôs official, all-in-one docs site builder.

  • Material UI 6.1 ‚Äì Independent React components using Material¬†Design.

  • Varlet 3.5 ‚Äì Material Design-inspired component library for Vue¬†3.

  • Preact 10.24 ‚Äì The 3KB React-compatible¬†alternative.

  • NodeBB 3.9 ‚Äì Node.js based forum¬†system.

#‚Äã707 ‚Äî October 3, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

VoidZero: A Next-Generation Toolchain for JavaScript ‚Äî Not content to have merely created Vue.js and Vite, JavaScript powerhouse Evan You has unveiled his latest adventure: a $4.6m funded company building an open-source unified development toolchain for the JavaScript ecosystem. With his track record, this is as good an attempt as it¬†gets.

Evan You

ESLint Now Officially Supports Linting JSON and Markdown ‚Äî ESLint has been taking steps to become a more general purpose linter and that effort is beginning to bear fruit with this¬†milestone.

Nicholas C. Zakas

Run GitHub Actions Up to 2x Faster at Half the Cost ‚Äî Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code¬†faster.

Blacksmith sponsor

Tauri 2.0: Small, Fast Desktop Apps using Web Technologies ‚Äî Tauri is a Rust-based alternative to Electron for bringing together HTML, JavaScript and CSS code to create cross-platform desktop apps. Rather than using V8, it uses the natively available webview to run your¬†code.

Tillmann Weidinger

IN BRIEF:

  • üòç Build tool Vite has a snazzy new homepage just in time for ViteConf.

  • The Svelte team shares everything that's new with Svelte lately.

  • üïπÔ∏è OneJS is an attempt to bring JavaScript scripting into the Unity game engine. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†Here's a screencast showing it¬†off.

  • üéÇ The Knip code decluttering tool celebrates two years with a new release containing a revamped auto-fix mechanism for automatically removing unused exports and files from your¬†code.

  • Congratulations to Ulises Gasc√≥n for becoming the newest TC39 Delegate.

RELEASES:

  • Eleventy / 11ty 3.0 ‚Äì Node.js-powered static site generator.

  • Tabulator 6.3 ‚Äì Popular interactive table / data grid¬†control.

  • Jiti 2.0 ‚Äì Runtime TypeScript and ESM support for¬†Node.js.

  • pnpm 9.12 ‚Äì The alternative, efficient package¬†manager.

ViteConf is Live! ‚Äî Join us today and tomorrow for ViteConf¬†2024!

StackBlitz sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Bundling: The Past, Present and Future ‚Äî A history lesson on bundlers, why they‚Äôre used, the problems they solve, the current ecosystem, and a look at the potential future for these¬†tools.

Devon Govett

Unleash JavaScript's Potential with Functional Programming ‚Äî More focused on the how, rather than the why, but a good primer nonetheless, especially if you‚Äôve never tried to learn about FP¬†before.

Jan Hesters

An Online Event You Won‚Äôt Want to Miss ‚Äî üî• JetBrains JavaScript Day returns Oct 24, and it promises to be the best one yet! Explore an impressive agenda and register for free¬†today.

JetBrains sponsor

SVG Coding Examples: Useful Recipes for Writing Vectors by Hand ‚Äî Explores the basics of hand-coding SVGs, how to use JavaScript along the way, and practical examples to demystify the inner workings of common SVG¬†elements.

Myriam Frisano

üìÑ Web Components are Not Framework Components and That‚Äôs Okay Lea Verou

üì∫ Laravel vs Rails for JavaScript Developers Sam Lewis

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

ü§ñ¬†assistant-ui: React Components for AI Chat ‚Äî It doesn‚Äôt just give you the interface components, but has integrations for Vercel AI, Langchain, and talking to other common LLM APIs (e.g. OpenAI), enabling you to build your own in-house AI chat system quickly. Examples.

Simon Farshid

qrframe: A Library to Generate 'Pretty' QR Codes ‚Äî It's slightly odd as the QR codes generated aren‚Äôt guaranteed to scan reliably, but if you can generate ones that do, they look striking, and could be useful for branding/fun use cases. Play around with a live demo¬†here.

Kyle Zheng

Announcing MongoDB 8.0 ‚Äî Over 30% Faster Than Before ‚Äî Learn how MongoDB 8.0 was built to exceed the most stringent security, availability, and performance¬†requirements.

MongoDB 8.0 sponsor

Superdiff 2.0: Compares Two Arrays or Objects and Return a Diff ‚Äî Got two similar objects and want to see the underlying¬†differences?

antoine

¬µExpress / Ultimate Express: Like Express, But Faster ‚Äî Imagine a reimplementation of Express with full API compatibility, but based on ¬µWebSockets and with an optimized router for faster¬†performance.

dimden

VueFormify 1.1: Simple Type-Safe Form Building for Vue ‚Äî Bills itself as ‚Äúyour ticket to form-building autonomy.‚Äù There‚Äôs a getting started guide and GitHub¬†repo.

M√°t√© Nagy

pretty-print: Customizable String Representations of JS Values ‚Äî Produce a string representation of any value. Similar to util.inspect but with many extra options for tree-ifying, coloring, sorting, choosing what to display, etc.

Effectful Technologies Inc
